habitat_description:
The ornate chorus frog ranges in the Coastal Plain from North Carolina to east Louisiana and south through extreme eastern Louisiana into Florida; the southernmost location of a population in Florida is Lake County (Conant and Collins 1998). 
Preferred habitats are pine barren ponds, Carolina Bays, rain-flooded meadows, sinkhole ponds, shallow roadside ditches, borrow pits, flatwood ditches, and cypress ponds and their respective environs (Conant and Collins 1998; Lannoo 2005). Breeding occurs in flooded pastures, roadside ditches, and shallow ponds; Bodies of water where they occur are characterized by low vegetation density (Behler and King 1979).
